text: If your Accounting shows you spend more on comfort than on your future, which paths feel more rational?

options.text: Cut current lifestyle for a secure retirement
View it as an investment in current mental health

text: Which factors do you prioritize most in your personal Accounting and tax planning?

options.text: Maximizing legal tax deductions
Simplicity and low maintenance of records
Long-term transparency for future audits
Outsourcing everything to a professional

text: In professional Accounting, which ethical line should never be crossed even for business survival?

options.text: Under-reporting income to save on taxes
Inflating asset values for bank loans
Hiding operational losses from investors
Manipulating expense dates to hit quarterly targets

text: Which Addiction is most socially accepted yet destructive in modern corporate culture?

options.text: Workaholism and weekend emails
Constant notification checking
Dependency on status and peer approval
Caffeine as a survival tool

text: What are the most effective ways to combat a digital Addiction in a remote work era?

options.text: Strict 'No-Screen' hours before sleep
Deleting non-essential social media apps
Engaging in high-intensity PhysicalTherapy or sports
Using physical notebooks instead of digital tools

text: Which hidden Addiction do you believe is rising the most among high-achieving professionals?

options.text: Addiction to over-planning and control
Addiction to constant self-improvement content
Addiction to high-risk financial Trading

text: Does aggressive Advertising influence your choices regarding Career or Finance?

options.text: Yes, brands create an illusion of reliability
No, I only trust raw data and reviews

text: Which forms of Advertising do you find most invasive in your daily Life?

options.text: Targeted social media ads based on browsing
Unsolicited marketing Emails and spam

Audio ads during Podcasts or music

text: Can modern Advertising ever be purely ethical, or is its core always Manipulation?

options.text: It can be ethical if it solves real problems
It is always a form of psychological persuasion
It is just Information with a biased lens

text: If your Banking provider offers a lucrative loan, what are the main factors that stop you?

Risk of losing stable income in the future

Principled refusal to live off future resources

options.text: Yes, banks are slow and outdated
No, banks provide a level of safety Crypto lacks
They will merge into a hybrid financial system

text: Which Behavior do you find most toxic yet effective for a BusinessStrategy?

options.text: Brutal honesty without empathy

text: Which aspects of human Behavior are hardest to predict in a crisis?

options.text: Panic buying and Resource hoarding

text: How much does peer Behavior influence your long-term Career decisions?

options.text: A lot, I want to keep up with my circle
Very little, I follow my own Logic

text: What are the hardest things to cut when you are strictly Budgeting your life?

options.text: Quality food and health supplements

options.text: A sense of total Control over Life

options.text: Fear of losing established social status

options.text: Constant Innovation and tech lead

options.text: Yes, clean play rarely leads to the top

options.text: Yes, businesses can thrive while doing good
No, the drive for Profit always wins

No, without passion you will eventually burn out
